experiences.overview: full stack engineering alongside a team of 7 for copilot/ anvi, an integrated multi-agent ai assistant and automation platform embedded into planview's work management software suite

led e2e development of prompt and workflow template library, increasing user adoption of saved prompts and workflows
designed mcp server integration registry for hybrid tool calling client, increasing quality and accuracy of answers while maintaining backwards compatibility with non-mcp tools
developed system prompt injection pipeline api for response personalization, increasing per-user customizability
developed e2e follow up prompt generation pipeline, increasing per-session user interactions and overall retention

led migration of unobfuscated logs to independent secure logging pipeline pushed to cloudwatch via fluent bit daemonset to remain compliant with data retention policy while maintaining full observability

items.description: i love the cross section of engineering, sport, and speed. unfortunately, i support ferarri.
i primarily follow the premier league and european football, though i also keep up with international games and the mls. i support liverpool (rip jota ❤️).

girlfriend got me back back into pokemon tcg recently. collection isn't great but i have a few cool cards worth a bit of money. i got an xy evolutions booster box for my 12th birthday (worth ~3k now). my favorite pokemon is ditto. also used to play a lot of pokemon go.
i hope to own and maintain a clean nb or nc miata in the near future. smart financial decisions currently limit me to driving family-shared 2020 prius prime (it's nice though, no complaints from me).
i like sewing to make my clothes fit the way i want them to. 80-90% of the clothes i wear are altered in some way by me because clothes usually don't fit me that well off the rack.
i've run mini-itx builds since i first got into pcs. currently running a 5600x and a 3070.
vegas pro user since 2018. made montages, school projects, funny short-form videos, and more.

i've been hooked on topre for quite some time. i primarily use a realforce r3s (45g topre) which i got when i was visiting japan in 2025. i also recently bought an hhkb pro hybrid type-s with silenced topres which i'm super excited about. layout is a bit weird on windows but i can definitely see the ergonomic benefits. i have a few other custom boards with more traditional cherry style switches, both soldered and hot-swappable, some made of plastic, some made of lego :D

don't play as many video games anymore because of priorities and time constraints. still play a bit of valorant and clash royale. previously played a lot of fortnite, gta, f1, fifa/fc, minecraft, need for speed, fall guys.
have been playing for 15+ years, 3 of those in vyso. a lot more on and off now because of school, work, life.
